did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Army officer. Correspondence, letterbooks, telegrams, writings, reports, orders, financial records, scrapbooks, and other papers relating primarily to the Civil War, Reconstruction, Mexican border disputes, Indian wars, and Sheridan's service as commanding general of the army.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

geogname.part: Bighorn Mountains (Wyo. and Mont.)--Discovery and exploration.
Shenandoah River Valley (Va. and W. Va.)--History--Civil War, 1861-1865.

title.part: Philip Henry Sheridan Papers at the Library of Congress

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Philip Henry Sheridan, army officer, were deposited in the Library of Congress in 1931-1932 by his widow, Irene Rucker Sheridan. In 1948, heirs to his estate converted the deposit to a gift. The collection was augmented by a transfer of items from the papers of Sheridan's secretary, Daniel O. Drennan, which were donated in 1946 by Mrs. Charles H. Kneessi.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Sheridan Papers were processed in 1960 and prepared for microfilming in 1985. The finding aid was revised in 2005.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p:
In 1962, the Library published
Philip H. Sheridan, A Register of His Papers in the Library of Congress . The register was amended when the papers were microfilmed in 1985.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright in the unpublished writings of Philip Henry Sheridan is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Philip Henry Sheridan are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

altformavail.head: Microfilm
altformavail.p: A microfilm edition of these papers is available on 104 reels. Consult reference staff in the Manuscript Division concerning availability for purchase or interlibrary loan. To promote preservation of the originals, researchers are required to consult the microfilm edition as available.

altformavail.head: Online Content
altformavail.p: The papers of Philip Henry Sheridan are available on the Library of Congress Web site at http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.mss/collmss.ms000038.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container or reel number, Philip Henry Sheridan Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of Philip Henry Sheridan (1831-1888) span the years 1853 to 1896, with the bulk of the material originating between 1862 and 1887. The collection includes correspondence, reports, orders, memorabilia, scrapbooks, commissions, financial records, and speeches organized in the following series:
General Correspondence ,
Autograph Letters ,
Letterbooks ,
Field Dispatches and Telegrams ,
Military Papers ,
Subject File ,
Book and Speech File ,
Miscellany ,
Scrapbooks , and
Oversize .

The papers relate chiefly to the Civil War, Reconstruction, Mexican border disputes, Indian wars, and military administration. There is very little material concerning Sheridan's family and personal life. Dominated by correspondence and reports, the papers document Sheridan's service as an army commander in the Civil War and his postwar commands up to and including that of commanding general of the United States Army. The papers also include material relating to George A. Forsyth's Europe-Asia observation tour; the Piegan expedition; Gouverneur K. Warren's court of inquiry; Rebecca Wright, a Federal spy at Winchester, Virginia; reconnaissance of Bighorn Mountain and the valleys of the Bighorn and Yellowstone rivers; and Henry Page's letterbooks as quartermaster for the Army of the Potomac. Correspondents include George A. Forsyth (aide and secretary), James W. Forsyth, Ulysses S. Grant, Michael V. Sheridan (his brother), and William T. Sherman. There are two letters from Abraham Lincoln to Sheridan, September 20 and October 22, 1864.

Included also is a draft of Sheridan's published memoirs. Following the destruction of some of Sheridan's papers in the Chicago fire of 1871, a large number of transcripts were made from the records of the War Department by his secretaries. These transcripts have been interfiled with the surviving original papers.

arrangement.head: Organization of the Papers
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in ten series:

scopecontent.p: Letters, telegrams, and memoranda sent and received.

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically with undated items at the end of most years and at the end of the series.

scopecontent.p: Letters received from William T. Sherman and Ulysses S. Grant and miscellaneous letters sent by Sheridan.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by name of person and thereunder chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Copies of letters sent and received.

arrangement.p: Grouped into general correspondence and correspondence signed by aides and clerks and arranged thereunder chronologically. Most volumes are indexed.

did.unittitle: Correspondence signed by aides and clerks

scopecontent.p: Field dispatches and telegrams sent and received.

arrangement.p: Grouped as items sent and items received and filed thereunder chronologically. Some volumes are indexed.

did.unittitle: Sent, 1862, June-1871, Oct. (incomplete film ends at 1865, Mar. 25)

scopecontent.p: Endorsements, official correspondence of the Department of the Gulf, operations reports, orders, and reports.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by type of material and filed thereunder by topic or chronology.

did.unittitle: 1873, Jan. 2-1877, Dec. 16 (incomplete film ends at 1876, Sept. 7)
Official correspondence, Department of the Gulf
Division and brigade commanders' reports, Cavalry Corps, Army of the Potomac, 1864
Division and brigade commanders' reports, Cavalry Corps, Army of the Potomac, 1864
Division and brigade commanders' reports, Cavalry Corps, Army of the Potomac, 1864
Shenandoah Valley campaign, 1864-1865 ; Winchester, Va., raid, 1865 , pages 1-164
Sub-reports of engagements, campaigns, and scouts against Indians, Military Division of Missouri, 1869 , pages 1-335
Sub-reports of military operations against the Indians and miscellaneous papers pertaining to Indian matters, 1868-1869
Operations reports index to vols. 1-5 (lacking vol. 5)

scopecontent.p: Correspondence, telegram books, reports, newspaper clippings, and printed matter.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by subject and thereunder chronologically.

did.unittitle: Forsyth, George A., Europe-Asia observation tour
Page, Henry, telegram books, quartermaster, Army of the Potomac
Warren, Gouverneur K., court of inquiry, 1880-1883
Wright, Rebecca, federal spy, Winchester, Va., 1864
Reconnaissance of the Bighorn Mountains and the valleys of the Bighorn and Yellowstone rivers, 1877

arrangement.p: The memoirs are arranged by volume and chapter and the speeches chronologically.

scopecontent.p: Biographical material, citations, charges and specifications against Sheridan, commissions, contingent fund records, memorabilia, newspaper clippings, personal financial records, printed matter, and expressions of sympathy.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by type of material.
Arranged and described according to the series, containers, and folders from which the items were removed.
